summary: This bill, the "Stopping the Theft and Destruction of Broadband Act of 2025," aims to amend section 1362 of title 18 of the United States Code. It seeks to prohibit the destruction of broadband internet access service by clarifying its definition and scope. The bill defines broadband internet access service and includes any service deemed a functional equivalent by the Federal Communications Commission. It also broadens the scope of the existing law to include facilities and entities beyond those operated or controlled by the United States.
